p: Influenza viruses, particularly A viruses, cause epidemics and pandemics in human populations, resulting in enormous suffering and economic losses. ( 1) Influenza virus infections can cause severe complications such as pneumonia and encephalitis and can increase the rate of hospitalization and mortality, particularly in young children and elderly people. ( 2, 3) The M2 ion channel inhibitors amantadine and rimantadine and neuraminidase inhibitors zanamivir and oseltamivir have been used to treat influenza virus infections. Recently, neuraminidase inhibitor-resistant influenza A viruses were reported and an antiviral reagent against RNA-dependent RNA polymerase in influenza virus was developed. ( 4â€“ 7)
